questions.question: What is the basic unit of life?
questions.explanation: The cell is the basic structural and functional unit of all living organisms.

questions.question: Which organelle is known as the powerhouse of the cell?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria produce ATP, the energy currency of the cell.

questions.question: All living things are made of cells.
questions.explanation: This is one of the fundamental principles of cell theory.

questions.question: The process by which plants make food is called ___
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis converts light energy into chemical energy stored in glucose.

questions.question: What is the genetic material found in the nucleus of cells?
questions.explanation: DNA (Deoxyribonucleic acid) contains the genetic instructions for all living organisms.
